title: Real-time data synchronization complexity
description: Managing real-time updates across multiple data sources (GitHub, Jira, internal APIs) while maintaining consistency and handling network failures gracefully.
mitigation: Implementing event-driven architecture with message queues, implementing graceful degradation to cached data, and comprehensive monitoring of data freshness.
contingency: Fall back to batch updates every 5 minutes if real-time sync fails

title: User adoption slower than expected
description: Development teams may resist adopting a new dashboard tool, preferring existing tools or manual processes they're comfortable with.
mitigation: Conducting user interviews, implementing gradual rollout with early adopter teams, providing comprehensive training materials, and ensuring easy migration from existing tools.
contingency: Pivot to integration-heavy approach, embedding into existing tools rather than replacing them

title: Performance degradation with large datasets
description: Dashboard performance may suffer when displaying data from large projects with thousands of tasks, extensive history, or complex dependency graphs.
mitigation: Implementing virtual scrolling, pagination, data aggregation strategies, and intelligent caching layers. Conducting performance testing with simulated large datasets.
contingency: Implement progressive disclosure and summary views for large datasets

title: Third-party API rate limiting
description: GitHub and Jira APIs have rate limits that could restrict our ability to provide real-time updates for active projects, especially during peak usage.
mitigation: Implementing intelligent caching strategies, request batching, multiple API key rotation, and fallback to webhook-based updates where available.
contingency: Reduce update frequency during rate limit periods and implement user notifications

title: Key team member availability
description: Heavy reliance on Krin for AI coordination and technical architecture decisions could create bottlenecks if availability becomes limited.
mitigation: Cross-training team members on critical systems, comprehensive documentation of architectural decisions, and establishing clear escalation procedures.
contingency: Engage external technical advisor and prioritize knowledge transfer sessions

title: Security vulnerabilities in dependencies
description: Using multiple npm packages and third-party integrations increases attack surface and potential for security vulnerabilities in our supply chain.
mitigation: Automated dependency scanning, regular security updates, minimal dependency policy, and security-focused code reviews. Implementing CSP headers and input validation.
contingency: Rapid incident response plan and automated rollback capabilities

title: Scope creep from stakeholder requests
description: Multiple stakeholder groups may request additional features that could significantly expand scope beyond the MVP timeline and budget.
mitigation: Clear feature prioritization framework, regular stakeholder alignment meetings, and formal change request process with impact assessment.
contingency: Defer non-critical features to Phase 2 and maintain strict MVP focus

title: Data privacy and compliance requirements
description: Handling project data from multiple organizations may require compliance with various data protection regulations (GDPR, SOC2, etc.).
mitigation: Data classification framework, encryption at rest and in transit, audit logging, and privacy-by-design architecture. Legal compliance review scheduled.
contingency: Implement data residency controls and customer-managed encryption keys
